nodes.name: Conditional actions relate to agent goals
nodes.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 a) (if (and (cond e e1 e2)(agentOf a e2)(etc)) (exists (g) (and (goal g a) (or (enable e1 g)(not' g e1))))))
nodes.english: If there is a conditional action by an agent a, then either the condition enables a goal of a's or the negation of the condition is a goal of a's. In the first case the agent is exploiting the occurrence of the condition. In the second he is escaping from the consequences of the condition. In either case, the condition is relevant to his goals.

nodes.name: WhileDo negation goal
nodes.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 a) (if (and (whileDo e e1 e2)(agentOf a e2)(etc)) (exists (e0) (and (not' e0 e1)(goal e0 a)))))
nodes.english: The negation of the condition in a whileDo is defeasibly a goal of the agent's. That's why the agent keeps executing the body until the condition is gone.

nodes.name: RepeatUntil termination goal
nodes.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 a) (if (and (repeatUntil e e1 e2)(agentOf a e1)(etc)) (goal e2 a)))
nodes.english: A similar rule holds for repeatUntil. The termination condition e2 is defeasibly a goal of the agent's.

nodes.name: Definition of partialSubplan
nodes.fol: (forall (p1 p c) (iff (partialSubplan p1 p c) (exists (a g1) (and (subplan p1 p)(plan p1 a g1) (partialPlan p1 a g1 c)))))
nodes.english: A partial subplan is one in which the terminal nodes are not all executable, given a set of constraints c.

nodes.name: Definition of subplanAgent
nodes.fol: (forall (a p1 p) (iff (subplanAgent a p1 p) (and (subplan p1 p) (forall (e) (if (and (subgoalIn e p1) (exists (a1) (agentOf a1 e))) (agentOf a e))))))
nodes.english: Someone is a subplan agent if they are the agent of every action in the subplan. That is, a is the agent of every subgoal in the subplan p1 that has an agent.

nodes.name: Definition of planTermination
nodes.fol: (forall (e p) (iff (planTermination e p) (exists (a g) (and (subgoalIn e p)(plan p a g) (forall (e1) (if (subgoalIn e1 p)(not (before e e1)))) (causalComplex p g)(cause e g)))))
nodes.english: The termination of a plan is the final action in the plan, after which the goal is achieved.

nodes.name: Definition of knowledgePrecondition
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 e) (iff (knowledgePrecondition e1 e) (exists (a e2) (and (enable e1 e)(know' e1 a e2)))))
nodes.english: A knowledge precondition is the eventuality of someone a knowing something e2 where that knowing is an enabling condition in the causal complex for e.

nodes.name: Definition of resourcePrecondition
nodes.fol: (forall (e1 e) (iff (resourcePrecondition e1 e) (exists (a s x e2) (and (at' e1 x a s)(enable e1 e2)(changeIn' e2 x) (causallyInvolved e2 e)))))
nodes.english: A resource precondition involves having a resource at hand that enables an action through undergoing change that is causally involved in the effect. What distinguishes both resources and tools is that they go through a change of state (perhaps location) and that change plays an intermediate causal role in the effect occurring.

nodes.name: Definition of conditionalPlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a g) (iff (conditionalPlan p a g e) (exists (e1) (and (plan p a g)(cond p e e1)))))
nodes.english: A conditional plan is a plan whose corresponding event is a conditional event. That is, p is a plan of a's to achieve goal g, executed only when condition e occurs.

nodes.name: Definition of repetitivePlan
nodes.fol: (forall (p a g) (iff (repetitivePlan p a g) (exists (e1 e2) (and (plan p a g) (or (whileDo p e1 e2)(repeatUntil p e1 e2))))))
nodes.english: A repetitive plan is a plan with a 'while do' or 'repeat until' structure.

nodes.name: Definition of periodicSubplan
nodes.fol: (forall (p1 p) (iff (periodicSubplan p1 p) (exists (t) (and (subplan p1 p)(timeSpanOf t p1) (periodicTseq t)))))
nodes.english: Periodic subplans can be defined as plans whose time spans are periodic temporal sequences.

nodes.name: Definition of requiredPrecondition
nodes.fol: (forall (e0 e) (iff (requiredPrecondition e0 e) (exists (e1 e2) (and (or' e e1 e2)(enable e0 e1)(enable e0 e2)))))
nodes.english: A required precondition is an eventuality that is an enabling condition for a disjunctive effect. That is, it is a precondition of each disjunct.

node_types.variable: Frequently used variables (2+ axioms in chapter)
